The Strathmore University SDG Hub



An SDSN Youth Initiative based in Strathmore University, Nairobi, Kenya.




About Us





The SDG Students Program is an initiative of SDSN Youth, the global youth division of the UN Sustainable Development Solutions Network (SDSN). SDSN Youthâ€™s mission is to empower young people globally to create sustainable solutions.

Through the SDG Students Program, SDSN Youth aims to engage students in the global effort to achieve the 2030 Agenda and the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), as well as empowering them with the knowledge, skills, and pathways to action to be effective agents of change today.





Why Young People?




They make up nearly HALF the world's population - the biggest generation we are yet to see - and are the most educated, charitable, and entrepreneurial amongst other age groups.

We believe that Young People are the ideal agents to be at the forefront of the sustainable development movement: they are forward-thinking, creative, and come in large numbers.










SDSN Youth Today



SDSN Youth was launched in 2015 by Professor Sachs - at the 5th meeting of the SDSN Leadership Council in Paris. Over the past five years, we have expanded rapidly, with over 3000 program members worldwide.



Theory of Change



We ensure that students from all walks of life can: LEARN about the SDGs, ENGAGE with & develop a passion for the SDGs, and ACT on implementing these SDGs in the community.

Vision

To transform universities into hubs of innovation for solutions to local problems.

Vision



To transform universities into hubs of innovation for solutions to local problems.

Mission

Establish a local network of hubs where students are brought together to take action on SDGs.

Mission



Establish a local network of hubs where students are brought together to take action on SDGs.

Recent Activities

Inaugural Climate Change Summit 2022

Inaugural Climate Change Summit was held at Strathmore University in conjunction w/ the Environment & Sustainability Club, Strathmore Business School (SBS), and the Art Club.
It was an opportunity for the youth to interact and inspire each other to innovate sustainable solutions aimed at protecting our one and only Earth.


Speakers included; Eng. Millicent Alooh - HSC from Cancer Care Kenya, Tomas Hurdsone - Founder & CEO of Youth Greenspace Action & Network.

One of the highlights of the Summit was watching the Journey to Justice Film from Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung - Rule of Law Program for Anglophone Sub-Saharan Africa - which highlighted the journey to environmental justice in Kenya.

Furthermore, We were pleased to have Patrick Kiarie - Kenya Country Director for 'We Don't Have Time', and Esther Muiruri - Programs Officer for Disaster Risk Reduction, Climate Change Adaptation & Environment at Kenya Red Cross.

They were featured on the panel to discuss "Climate Governance - The Role of the Youth."

SDGs & Me Campaign w/ Vijana Tupo Initiative - July 17th 2022

Quite an intimate session where we shared our sentiments on the SDGs, youth's prospects on the SDGs with Vijana Tupo Initiative, and the role of technology plus youth with the AFRICA DIGITAL ACADEMY.

It was insightful to have conversations with the youth in various spaces of action.


We learned a lot and are proud of this campaign's continuous support and outcomes in the SDG space.

If you want to be a part of this campaign, feel free to reach out and learn more about how you can be an SDG champion in your community!
